TRANSLATION: (1) For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1996] -
FOOTNOTES: [1996]- i.e., the honor and reputation Allāh had given them as guardians of the Holy Kaʿbah, which allowed them to travel without fear of being harmed.

TRANSLATION: (2) Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer[1997] -
FOOTNOTES: [1997]- i.e., the trading caravans that traveled south in winter and north in summer.

TRANSLATION: (3) Let them worship the Lord of this House,[1998]

ARABIC_TEXT: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ
TRANSLATION: (4) Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
